body_html:
Hi again!

Pete, I used your commands starting the whole thing fresh and it worked!

So, the only difference between your commands and the ones in the documentation is that in your commands you use directly the "CXX=g++-4.8" in
make -f tensorflow/contrib/makefile/Makefile HOST_OS=PI TARGET=PI OPTFLAGS="-Os -mfpu=neon-vfpv4 -funsafe-math-optimizations -ftree-vectorize" CXX=g++-4.8
but in the documentation the user first fails in the same command because of gcc 4.9 and the tries again adding the CXX=g++-4.8.

Without being 100% sure, I think that this causes the memory corruption issue, because this is the only thing I did differently compared to your command listing.

Hi again!

Pete, I used your commands starting the whole thing fresh and it worked!

So, the only difference between your commands and the ones in the documentation is that in your commands you use directly the "CXX=g++-4.8" in
make -f tensorflow/contrib/makefile/Makefile HOST_OS=PI TARGET=PI OPTFLAGS="-Os -mfpu=neon-vfpv4 -funsafe-math-optimizations -ftree-vectorize" CXX=g++-4.8
but in the documentation the user first fails in the same command because of  gcc 4.9 and the tries again adding the CXX=g++-4.8.

Without being 100% sure, I think that this causes the memory corruption issue, because this is the only thing I did differently compared to your command listing.
